old.response_text:
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #1
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
_King James Bible_ (2017) King James Bible Online. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/ (Original work published: 1769)

SOURCE TYPE: webpage

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Authors: Missing/incorrect author placement
   What’s wrong: The citation begins with the title; there is no author. For web pages the organization that produced the page should be listed as the author (if no individual author is given).
   Should be: **Author (organization) at the start**, e.g., _King James Bible Online_. (If the organization name is the same as the site name, list it as the author and omit a duplicate site-name after the title.)

❌ Date: Incomplete date
   What’s wrong: The citation has only the year "(2017)". Your web-page rule requires a full date in the order year, month day.
   Should be: Include the full date if available, e.g., (_2017, March 15_). If the full date truly is unknown, use (2017) or (n.d.) per APA guidance, but per your rule supply the full date when possible.

❌ Placement of original-publication note (minor style)
   What’s wrong: The original-work publication note is present but its placement/format could be clearer.
   Should be: Place the original-work note immediately after the title in parentheses, e.g.: _King James Bible_ _(Original work published 1769)_.

Example corrected format (using a placeholder full date — replace Month Day with the actual date if known):
King James Bible Online. (2017, Month Day). _King James Bible_ (Original work published 1769). https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
CITATION #2
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
Malory, T. (2017). _Le morte d'Arthur_ (P. J. C. Field, Ed.). D. S. Brewer.

SOURCE TYPE: book

VALIDATION RESULTS:

✓ No APA 7 formatting errors detected

Notes: Author name, year in parentheses, title italicized, editor indicated as "(P. J. C. Field, Ed.)", and publisher present — this follows APA 7 book-entry conventions.

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
CITATION #3
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
Leitch, M. G., & Rushton, C. J. (Eds.). 2019. _A New Companion to Malory_. D. S. Brewer.

SOURCE TYPE: book (edited)

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Year / Editor formatting: Year not enclosed in parentheses and in the wrong position
   What’s wrong: The editors are given as "(Eds.). 2019." — APA requires the editors parenthetical and the publication year in parentheses immediately after the author/editor element.
   Should be: _Leitch, M. G., & Rushton, C. J. (Eds.). (2019). _A New Companion to Malory_._ D. S. Brewer._

Corrected example:
Leitch, M. G., & Rushton, C. J. (Eds.). (2019). _A New Companion to Malory_. D. S. Brewer.

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
CITATION #4
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
I. O. for Standardization. (2018). _Occupational health and safety management systems—Requirements with guidance for use_ (ISO Standard No. 45001:2018). https://www.iso.org/standard/63787.html

SOURCE TYPE: webpage (standard / organization publication)

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Authors: Organization name incorrectly abbreviated
   What’s wrong: "I. O. for Standardization." is not the correct author name. Use the full organization name as author.
   Should be: _International Organization for Standardization._ as the author name.

❌ Date: Incomplete per your web-page rule
   What’s wrong: The citation lists only the year "(2018)". Your instruction requires a full date in the order year, month day for web pages.
   Should be: Include the full publication date if available, e.g., _(2018, March 12)_. If the exact day is not provided on the source, APA allows the year only, but per your rule try to supply the full date.

Other notes: The title (italicized) and the ISO standard number are correctly included, and the URL is present. If the organization is the author (as it is here), you do not need to repeat the site name after the title.

Example corrected format (replace Month Day with the actual date if known):
International Organization for Standardization. (2018, Month Day). _Occupational health and safety management systems—Requirements with guidance for use_ (ISO Standard No. 45001:2018). https://www.iso.org/standard/63787.html

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
CITATION #5
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
O’Connor, J., & Smith, L. (2017). _Nancy Clancy, late-breaking news!_ (R. Preiss Glasser, Illus.). HarperCollins Publishers.

SOURCE TYPE: book

VALIDATION RESULTS:

✓ No APA 7 formatting errors detected

Notes: Authors formatted correctly, year in parentheses, title italicized in sentence case, illustrator credited in parentheses, and publisher listed. (Optional stylistic note: APA often shortens publisher names by omitting words like "Publishers" where appropriate — e.g., "HarperCollins" — but the provided publisher name is acceptable.)

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

If you want, I can produce fully corrected reference-list entries for each item with exact dates looked up (I can search for the publication dates) or adjust the entries to strictly follow APA 7 conventions (e.g., omitting duplicate site names, standardizing publisher names).

new_v1.response_text:
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #1
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
_King James Bible_ (2017) King James Bible Online. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/ (Original work published: 1769)

SOURCE TYPE: webpage (online version of a classical work)

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ **Author / Order**: The author (or organization author) is not placed at the start. In APA the author comes before the date.  
   Should be: **Author first**. Example: _King James Bible Online. (2017)._ _King James Bible_. ...

❌ **Date**: Per your instructions for webpages, the date should include year, month, and day if available. The citation has only the year.  
   Should be: e.g., _(2017, Month Day)_ — use the full date if the page lists it; if no specific month/day is provided, indicate only the year but note that your instructions requested month and day.

❌ **Site name duplication**: If the organization name is the same as the website name (King James Bible Online), APA does not require repeating the site name after the title.  
   Should be: omit duplicate site name if used as author. Example below shows the preferred form.

Corrected example(s) (using markdown italics as requested):
- If the organization is the author and no month/day is available:
  King James Bible Online. (2017). _King James Bible_. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/ (Original work published 1769)

- If the webpage has a full date (replace with real month/day):
  King James Bible Online. (2017, June 12). _King James Bible_. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/ (Original work published 1769)

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #2
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
Malory, T. (2017). _Le morte d'Arthur_ (P. J. C. Field, Ed.). D. S. Brewer.

SOURCE TYPE: book (author with editor / edited edition)

VALIDATION RESULTS:

✓ No APA 7 formatting errors detected

Notes: The author, year, italicized title, editor parenthetical, and publisher are presented in the expected APA 7 style. (If you prefer sentence case for the title, ensure capitalization follows APA sentence-case rules; the current rendering is acceptable for a titled historical work.)

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #3
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
Leitch, M. G., & Rushton, C. J. (Eds.). 2019. _A New Companion to Malory_. D. S. Brewer.

SOURCE TYPE: edited book

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ **Year / Parentheses placement**: The year should be in parentheses immediately after the author/editor information. Here the year is outside parentheses and separated by a period.  
   Should be: _Leitch, M. G., & Rushton, C. J. (Eds.). (2019)._

Corrected example:
Leitch, M. G., & Rushton, C. J. (Eds.). (2019). _A New Companion to Malory_. D. S. Brewer.

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #4
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
I. O. for Standardization. (2018). _Occupational health and safety management systems—Requirements with guidance for use_ (ISO Standard No. 45001:2018). https://www.iso.org/standard/63787.html

SOURCE TYPE: standards document / web page from an organization

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ **Author (organization name)**: The organization name is incorrectly abbreviated/formatted as "I. O. for Standardization." APA references should use the full, official name of the organization (not spelled-out initials with periods).  
   Should be: _International Organization for Standardization_. (You may include the abbreviation in brackets on first mention if desired, e.g., International Organization for Standardization [ISO].)

Corrected example:
International Organization for Standardization. (2018). _Occupational health and safety management systems—Requirements with guidance for use_ (ISO Standard No. 45001:2018). https://www.iso.org/standard/63787.html

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #5
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
O’Connor, J., & Smith, L. (2017). _Nancy Clancy, late-breaking news!_ (R. Preiss Glasser, Illus.). HarperCollins Publishers.

SOURCE TYPE: book (children's book with an illustrator)

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ **Publisher name**: APA 7 prefers the publisher name without business words like "Publishers" when the commonly used publisher name is shorter. "HarperCollins Publishers" is usually rendered as "HarperCollins" in APA references.  
   Should be: _HarperCollins_

Corrected example:
O’Connor, J., & Smith, L. (2017). _Nancy Clancy, late-breaking news!_ (R. Preiss Glasser, Illus.). HarperCollins

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

If you want, I can produce fully corrected reference-list entries for all five items together (with consistent sentence-case titles and the preferred forms for organization names).

new_v2.response_text:
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #1
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
_King James Bible_ (2017) King James Bible Online. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/ (Original work published: 1769)

SOURCE TYPE: Webpage / Classical work (Bible)

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Author: Missing or incorrect author element
   What’s wrong: The citation does not present a corporate/organizational author. For a web version of a text the website or organization that is responsible for the content should be given as author (unless a personal author is shown).
   Should be: Use the organization as author, for example:
   King James Bible Online. (2017). _King James Bible_. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/ (Original work published 1769)

❌ Date: Missing full date (if available)
   What’s wrong: For web pages APA prefers the full date (Year, Month Day) when it is available on the page; the citation shows only the year.
   Should be: Provide full date if available, e.g.:
   King James Bible Online. (2017, May 10). _King James Bible_. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/ (Original work published 1769)

❌ Punctuation / placement of original-publication note
   What’s wrong: The original-publication note uses a colon and is awkwardly placed. APA places any "Original work published" note at the end of the reference in parentheses and without a colon.
   Should be: … https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/ (Original work published 1769).

Note: If the organization and website name are identical, omit a separate website-name element (as in the corrected examples above).

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #2
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
Malory, T. (2017). _Le morte d'Arthur_ (P. J. C. Field, Ed.). D. S. Brewer.

SOURCE TYPE: Book

VALIDATION RESULTS:

✓ No APA 7 formatting errors detected

Notes: Title is italicized and in sentence case, editor is shown in parentheses after the title, year and publisher are present. This matches APA 7 formatting for a work by an author with an editor of the edition.

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #3
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
Leitch, M. G., & Rushton, C. J. (Eds.). 2019. _A New Companion to Malory_. D. S. Brewer.

SOURCE TYPE: Book (edited book / editors as authors)

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Year / Parentheses and punctuation
   What’s wrong: The year must appear in parentheses immediately after the editor parenthetical; the citation currently has "(Eds.). 2019." (year is outside parentheses and punctuation is incorrect).
   Should be: Leitch, M. G., & Rushton, C. J. (Eds.). (2019). _A new companion to Malory_. D. S. Brewer.

Note: Also apply sentence case to the book title (only first word and proper nouns capitalized). I have shown that correction above (_A new companion to Malory_).

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #4
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
I. O. for Standardization. (2018). _Occupational health and safety management systems—Requirements with guidance for use_ (ISO Standard No. 45001:2018). https://www.iso.org/standard/63787.html

SOURCE TYPE: Standard (organization as author / webpage)

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Author: Incorrectly formatted corporate author name
   What’s wrong: "I. O. for Standardization." is not the correct way to present the corporate author. APA prefers the full organization name (not spaced initials).
   Should be: International Organization for Standardization. (2018). _Occupational health and safety management systems—Requirements with guidance for use_ (ISO Standard No. 45001:2018). https://www.iso.org/standard/63787.html

(Other elements—year, title in italics, standard number, URL—are present and acceptably formatted.)

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #5
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
O’Connor, J., & Smith, L. (2017). _Nancy Clancy, late-breaking news!_ (R. Preiss Glasser, Illus.). HarperCollins Publishers.

SOURCE TYPE: Book (children’s book with illustrator)

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Publisher name: Word choice
   What’s wrong: APA recommends using the publisher name as it is commonly presented while omitting business words such as "Co." or "Publishers" when unnecessary. "HarperCollins" is the preferred form rather than "HarperCollins Publishers."
   Should be: O’Connor, J., & Smith, L. (2017). _Nancy Clancy, late‑breaking news!_ (R. Preiss Glasser, Illus.). HarperCollins.

Otherwise the author names, year, title (sentence case), illustrator credit, and publisher are present in appropriate order.

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

If you’d like, I can produce corrected, final reference-list entries (one-line each) for all five citations using the exact APA 7 formatting (with italics indicated by underscores as requested).
